title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1211.21 - Compressed gases referenced to this section
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1211.21 - Compressed gases referenced to this section

State Regulations
(a) Compressed gases listed in section
1211.150
and referenced to this
section are restricted to a maximum quantity per vehicle of 100 pounds gross
weight provided, however, that the gross weight of each cylinder or tube is 10
pounds or less, and except that cyclopropane or ethylene for hospital use is
restricted to a maximum quantity per vehicle of 20 tubes or cylinders measuring
20 inches or less in length, and four and one-half inches or less in outside
diameter. (b) Empty containers which
last contained a compressed gas referenced to this section are not allowed
passage when the quantity and/or container size limitations exceed those
described above. (c) No empty tank
vehicle is allowed passage if the vehicle is used for the transportation of any
compressed gas referenced to this section. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1211.21

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
